definitions.definition: Of, resembling, or expressed as a proverb , cliché , fable , or fairy tale .
examples: The busyness of a beaver is proverbial .
The beaver in this instance upheld the reputation of the proverbial one: her output was prodigious.

definitions.definition: Not used in a literal sense, but as the subject of a well-known metaphor .
examples: The visit was a warning shot across our proverbial bows
I grew up in a prefab house on Main Street in 1950s suburbia, the second and last child of a proverbial nuclear family.

main_definition: Of, resembling, or expressed as a proverb , cliché , fable , or fairy tale .
secondary_definitions: Not used in a literal sense, but as the subject of a well-known metaphor .
